resources.string: A historic city founded by the Greeks in Jabal al-Akhdar in the far north-east of Libya, about 10 km away from the city of al-Bayda
The crime of a Libyan archaeological city in the southwestern part of the country in the Sahara is attributed to its ancient inhabitants. The city is not currently inhabited.
Talmaitha is a small town in northeastern Libya. Away from the city of Marg 20 km north.

Sousse is a small Libyan city located on the Mediterranean coast in the Green Mountain and 30 km east of the city of Baida. The city is located on the ruins of the ancient city of Apollonia, which is an open archaeological museum. This popular city of Sousse follows the Green Mountain.
Sabratha is a Libyan city whose name was given to the Greeks by the Proton Paul Kay of Leimon (port and city of Proton) and later known as Sabratha.

Ojela is an oasis and a small town in Libya, about 400 km south of Benghazi. The city is administratively affiliated with the municipality of the oases. It is one of the oldest cities in Libya, visited by the father of history Herodotus in the year 400 BC was named Ogila,

Oia is a former Roman colony in North Africa created by the Phoenicians who were the ancient inhabitants of Libya. The colony of Oia and its neighboring region of Tripoli was rich in goodness, reaching its height during the second and third centuries BC, which was attributed to the rule of the Severan dynasty. The name of the Oya colony today became Tripoli, the capital of modern Libya.

One of the former major northern African cities, it is located on the Mediterranean coast at the mouth of Wadi Lebda, a natural harbor 3 km east of Al Khums, 120 km east of Tripoli, the capital of Libya.

Ghadames is a Libyan city located near the triangle of Libya border with Tunisia and Algeria in the western part of the country at latitude 30.08 north and longitude 9.03 east, rising above sea level 357 meters. It is 543 kilometers southwest of the capital Tripoli.
Al-Lathama is a village or suburb located north of the center of Benghazi as it is about 3 km away from the city center and is an agricultural area.
Corinthia Bab Africa is a luxury hotel and an important tourist destination in Tripoli, the capital of Libya.

Rixos El Nasr is a hotel in Tripoli, the Libyan capital. The hotel belongs to the Rixos Hotels Group of Turkey and is set in a green area of 20,000 square meters in the Victory Forest, which is infested with eucalyptus trees, 10 kilometers from Tripoli International Airport. Talk with his presence.
Located in the heart of Tripoli and overlooking the Mediterranean Sea.
Bab Al Bahr Hotel is located near the old city, one of the landmarks of Tripoli, in addition to its location in the service towers area. Bab Al Bahr Hotel overlooks the Mediterranean coast.

Al Wedan Hotel in Tripoli, Libya. One of the oldest and oldest Libyan hotels, built during the Italian colonization of Libya, was founded in 1930. It had a dance hall, a casino, a theater and a cinema. The hotel is located in the Al-Dahra area in the center of Tripoli, close to the Italian Embassy and the Intercontinental Tripoli project

JW Marriott Tripoli is one of the luxury hotels of Marriott International in the Libyan capital Tripoli. This hotel is a modern landmark, rising to 36 floors in the modern business district in the center of the capital.
Radisson Blu Al Mahary is a five-star hotel in Tripoli, the capital of Libya.
Located in the commercial center of Tripoli, the 4-star Plasma Hotel offers soundproofed rooms with private balconies overlooking the sea or the city.
Just a 3-minute walk from the historic Old Town, Al Naher Hotel offers air-conditioned rooms. Guests enjoy free Wi-Fi in all areas.
Four Seasons Hotel is located in Tripoli, Libya in a prime location in the business district of the city and easy access to tourist attractions, restaurants and shopping areas.
Located in the commercial center of Tripoli, the 4-star hotel offers soundproofed rooms with private balconies overlooking the sea or the city.
Al - Khan Trabelsi Hotel in the old city of Tripoli

The Victoria Hotel is a 4 star hotel, consisting of 56 rooms and 7 suites under the highest standard of reception, cafe, restaurant and business lounge. The hotel is located in the center of the capital Tripoli
Located in the commercial center of Tripoli, the 4-star hotel offers soundproofed rooms with private balconies overlooking the sea or the city.
Haroun Hotel is located in the heart of the capital Tripoli - Dahra - famous for the pulse of the capital where many oil companies and local banks
Tripoli city center is 4 km away. Monuments, the castle and museums are within walking distance. The property is located near the harbor.
Thobacts Hotel provides comfortable 4-star accommodation in Tripoli. It is conveniently positioned for guests wanting to discover the area attractions

Located in the center of Tripoli, Albatra Hotel is set in a modern, high-rise building with glass facades. Rooms are decorated in an intimate style. The hotel offers panoramic views and free shuttle service.

The Great Eastern Race is a great race or "sand dune field" in the Sahara Desert. Most are located in the southeast of Algeria and the northeast of the lowland Sahara. The Great Eastern Race covers an area of about 600 km, 200 km north and south. The northeast edge of the race extends to neighboring Tunisia.

Mount Owainat is a mountain range in the border region of Libya-Egypt-Sudan, and covers an area of 1500 square kilometers and most of it is located in Libya. The area is known for its collection of ancient primitive paintings on mountain rocks, one of the first explorations in the region was made by Ahmed Pasha Hassanein, who drew his first maps in 1932

The Red Serail Museum or the Red Serail Museum Complex in Tripoli Citadel is one of the oldest and largest museums in Libya.It is practically divided into four levels: Museums displaying the heritage and history of Libya over different periods of time, including the civilizations of the Libyan tribes, Greeks, Phoenicians, Romans, Byzantines and Arab eras.

Jebel Gharbi or Jebel Nefoussa is a rocky mountain range located in the northwestern region of Libya.It starts from southeastern Tunisia and crosses the border to Nalut and continues to Gharyan and ends east of Gharyan.The mountain chain continues sporadically until five. The highest peak of the mountain is 968 meters.

The tomb of Aoun is a salt lake or oasis located in the Sahara desert in southern Libya.It is considered an important tourist destination. It is also characterized by its very hot water starting from a depth of 1.5 meters and stretching down.

Green Mountain is a high mountainous area covered by forests in northeastern Libya, characterized by its elevation from most areas of Libya and is characterized by high rainfall rates, in addition to the availability of fertile land suitable for agriculture.
Martyrs Square is one of the squares of Tripoli, the Libyan capital, bordered by the Red Serail.

Mount Waw al-Namus is a volcanic mountain in south central Libya and south of Harrouj. It is 575 meters high, and is considered one of the most strange areas of the world where it is on a volcanic mountain and a volcanic tin with black basaltic rocks, with a large number of multi-colored lakes scattered on the foot with plants such as reeds, bamboo and trees near them such as palm and the best.

One of the oldest mosques in the Libyan capital Tripoli. It is located in the center of the old city and forms part of the old and archaeological complex of the old city. The mosque attracts a large number of tourists and is adjacent to the arch of Marcus Aurelius in Tripoli.

Sabratha city is famous for its sandy beach on the Mediterranean Sea overlooking the pine forests and parks such as Sabratha family park, zoo as well as the light of the back and you can see the whole area and the archaeological city.

Sabha Castle is an impregnable fortress located in the southeast of the city of Sabha in southeastern Libya and located above a prominent hill and seen from all sides and has a history of jihad against colonialism.

Villa Celine is one of the villas built by the wealthy Romans outside the city walls, where these buildings are one of the most beautiful monuments if we cite the attention paid by the Romans for the establishment of such houses

The Arkno craters are a pair of corrosive impact craters located about 700 km west of Mount Arkno in Libya Kufra Basin. Their diameter is 10 kilometers and 6.8 kilometers. It is believed that the two craters formed together after a strong collision or what is called in the English "Impact event" at least 140 million years ago.

Janzour Museum Located in the town of Janzour, about 13 kilometers west of the Libyan capital Tripoli. The museum is located on the remains of an ancient cemetery dating from the first and fourth centuries AD discovered by accident in 1958.
The Ghadames Museum is a unique museum, displaying various archaeological and cultural treasures from different periods of Libyan-Amazigh history.

Libya Museum is an educational museum in which the exhibition system focused on the use of all sensory audiovisual and sensory. This museum is not like other traditional museums like the Red Saraya Museum. ”The location of the museum in the historic People Palace in downtown Tripoli was chosen with its large gardens and unique designs to make the exhibits more attractive.
